JBenchy is a toolkit that aims at productivity in the areas of gathering experimental data and creating reports and diagrams of them.

Packages
gr.forth.ics.jbenchy Provides API to easily store records in a database, and subsequently categorize and aggregate them by a set of variables.
gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram Provides core support for generating diagrams, typically from reports created by an Aggregator.
gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.gnuplot Provides support for generating gnuplot diagrams from reports generated by Aggregator.
gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.jfreechart Provides support for generating JFreeChart diagrams from reports generated by Aggregator.
gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.excel Utility for writing aggregator results in Microsoft Excel (XML) format.
gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.fluent  
gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.impl Provides support for implementing Aggregator.
gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.impl.derby Implementation of Aggregator based on the all-Java Derby database.

 

JBenchy is a toolkit that aims at productivity in the areas of gathering experimental data and creating reports and diagrams of them.

Typically, an experiment has the purpose of understanding the connection of some variables in regards to some measurements. To this aim, variables repeatedly take various combinations of values and an outcome is experimentally measured. Data would be stored in custom structures, and then, in order to analyze the data (to answer questions like "how does this variable influences the outcome", which could be translated to "show me the average of the outcome for each distinct value of this variable"), custom code would be required. Maintaining the ad-hoc structures and code is not easy, especially while researching and constantly changing the parameters of the experiment, as well as the questions to be answered.

JBenchy greatly simplifies the process of gathering data (storing them in an underlying, zero-configuration database) and reporting them. See gr.forth.ics.jbenchy for examples. Also, some support for automatically creating visual diagrams out of reports, see gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram, gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.gnuplot and gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.jfreechart.

Maintainer: Andreou Dimitris, contact at jim.andreou at gmail.com.
